svcsubproc.para: The function of the fuel supply system is to deliver fuel from the fuel tank(s) through a filter to the fuel injectors at a regulated pressure.

randlist.title: The Fuel System Consists of the Following Components:

item.para: Fuel passages within the cylinder head which supply the fuel injectors
Fuel pressure regulator and fuel return lines

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Pump
svcsubproc.para: The power steering and fuel pump assembly draws fuel from the tank(s) through an 80 micron fuel prescreen element and transfers pressurized fuel to the fuel filter housing. The fuel pump raises fuel pressure to insure proper filling of the fuel injectors.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Filter Housing
svcsubproc.para: Fuel in the filter housing passes through a 10 micron fuel filter cartridge to a standpipe in the center of the filter assembly, and then clean fuel passes through fuel supply lines to a machined gallery in each cylinder head.

The base of the fuel filter housing contains an electric heating element (optional) used to warm the fuel. This helps prevent fuel from waxing during cold weather operation. An optional Water In Fuel (WIF) sensor, in the base of the housing, detects water in the fuel. When water accumulates in the bottom of the fuel filter housing, the WIF sensor sends a signal to illuminate an amber colored WATER IN FUEL lamp in the instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: Pressure Regulator
svcsubproc.para: The pressure regulator contains a spring loaded valve to control pressure in the fuel galleries. Return fuel flows through the regulator and is routed to the fuel tank(s).
